channel.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
channel.description:
This is old news, but some people might not know about it, and I didn't see a thread so here goes. I came across a code for BFBC2 on the PC a couple days ago, and it takes 20 dollars off the price tag. Brings it down to 30 dollars, which is a good deal if you ask me. I just used the code, and I can vouch for it's legitimacy. Downloading it right now.
Oh, right. The code is PAXEAST842. Just enter it at eastore.ea.com after you add BFBC2 to your cart.

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
veteran.battlefield.com has been down for a long time. they shut it down and decided to put it up on https://www.badcompany2.ea.com/veteran instead. You need to login with your EA account though and then click Veteran button.

I guess they don’t communicate too well in the website department.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
and veteran.battlefield.com is completely down. So now Gamespy shows BF2, but my gamespy login still doesn’t do anything. Oh well, just have to ignore my OCD about this for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Elpants
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

Well I can’t get GameSpy to acknowledge that I have BF2 installed and the Veteran site still won’t acknowledge that I have Heroes so I don’t know what to do…

Give it some time, ever since BC2 came out, all their shit has been painfully slow at times.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Well I can’t get GameSpy to acknowledge that I have BF2 installed and the Veteran site still won’t acknowledge that I have Heroes so I don’t know what to do…

edit: now GameSpy has it under my games, but the veteran site still doesn’t list it when I give them my user/password…

And GameSpy has to be the shittiest program that I’ve ever used. Ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: BT_Snow
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

So is BC2 and Heroes enough or should I register my old copy of BF2 as well?

Yeah, just Heroes is enough. I registered all my Battlefield games for the original Bad Company game, where you get certain unlocks for doing that.

Ninja’d :hmph:

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Elpants
item.description:
I got my Garand with just Bad Company 2 and Battlefield Heroes.

Garand is nice if you can be accurate with it, but so help you god you get in close quarters combat with it.

I later added my Battlefield 1942 after entering in the Key 3 million times before it stopped telling me it was already claimed.

But yes Shrike, Heroes and BC2 is enough. Might as well register BF2 as well because they might add rewards for have a Veteran rank of 2+ later on.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
So is BC2 and Heroes enough or should I register my old copy of BF2 as well?

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: BT_Snow
item.description:
Heroes does work, If it didn’t my vet status would only be 5 instead of 6.

It’s also how my friend got his Garand, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
According to EA, along with everyone else I’ve talked to who has the Garand, Heroes works.

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Ajax
item.description:
Battlefield Heroes doesn’t work for the Veterans feature. It has to be BF 1942, Vietnam, 2, or 2142. Not sure if BC1 or 1943 work, and I’ve heard Vietnam has been having problems…but Heroes will not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Karriz:

Awesome multiplayer, and I liked singleplayer also, even tough it was not that excellent.
I mostly play as recon or medic, but maybe I should try engineer and assault also.

Recon class in tank. Stealth!

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Ajax:

Brother Shrike, you got a recipient for all those extra copies?

Anyway, the story isn’t amazing, like I said, the first one’s story was better…but it’s got it’s moments. It’s passable, at least. Everything single player was better in the first one…but BC2 has more quotable phrases, I think.

Never got to play multiplayer, though…really want to.

lol, I’m one of the recipients. My friend has a debit card, we give him cash, he deposits it, and he buys 4 packs.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield Bad Company 2
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
mattemuse:

$30 is a good deal, is it a good game?

Pretty much. Even I, a multiplayer hater, love it.

Read full topic
